Text: Heard a lot about it. Thanks.

The sample plays fine, but the movie does not.  Quick Time error 2002 (bad public movie atom).  VLC and GOM don't play either.

What's up?

You REALLY need to redo this.  Both MKVmerge and Handbrake 0.9.5 give ERROR messages when trying to remux them: 

No Title(s) found:
Your source may be copy protected, badly mastered or in a format Handbrake does not support.

MKV mege states:

Command line used:

"mkvmerge" --output-charset UTF-8 --identify-for-mmg "M:\Man Bites Dog [C'est arrive pres de chez vous] 1992 UNCUT 720p BRRip x264-BeLLBoY (Kingdom-Release)\Man Bites Dog (1992).mp4"

Output:

Error: The demultiplexer for the file 'M:\Man Bites Dog [C'est arrive pres de chez vous] 1992 UNCUT 720p BRRip x264-BeLLBoY (Kingdom-Release)\Man Bites Dog (1992).mp4' failed to initialize:

Quicktime/MP4 reader: Could not read the source file.

Has anyone tried using Subler ( http://code.google.com/p/subler/ - Mac only, but I'm sure there's a Windows equivalent) to re-wrap the video and audio in a new MP4 container? I will be using it anyway to quickly insert metadata and cover art to the file.

MKV and MP4 are often encoded with the same video codecs, so a program like Subler can turn an MKV into an MP4 in minutes just by recreating the wrapper instead of re-encoding the entire video and audio channels of the file.

It may be able to recreate the MP4 wrapper in minutes and fix the public atom issue.
